package.name: HTML_QuickForm_altselect
package.summary: An alternative to HTML_QuickForm_select using radio buttons and checkboxes
package.description: A QuickForm plugin that extends the select element and turns its options into checkboxes or radio buttons depending on whether the multiple html attribute was set or not. For extra options not listed, you can also render an 'Other' textfield.

release.notes: This is the initial release of the HTML_QuickForm_altselect package.
Fixed error message when export and nothing submitted for multiple select
- Fixed bug with freezing not being propagated correctly to individual elements when treating like a group.
- Use the QF function _findValue() to retrieve the element's value out of submitValues instead of direct access, in case the element name is using [] to specify that it is part of an array.

- Fixed exportValue so that it correctly exports the other value when assoc is true. Also uses _prepareValue to return a correct assoc array when returning a value. - Fixed setSelected so that it sets the other value always as the include_other option may not have been set by the time this function is called.
- Remove the _qf_other option from the option list after temporarily adding in exportValue. - Return from setSelected if a null value is passed.
- Export the array correctly now with the name of the element as the key. - Allowed multiple other options to be set in multiple mode.

- Renamed _getElements() to getElements() and added getElementName() to coincide with HTML_QuickForm_group for when registered as a group. - Only create the disable function when including the other textfield.
- Added ability to specifiy html attributes for each of the individual form elements. - Improved phpdoc commenting.

Added label tags for the element labels. Didn't include the labels as the text property of the radio or checkbox elements, as these may be required to render without the labels when rendering as a group in a template.
- Changed frozen html to use the individual element frozen html functions.
- Added PHP_EOL constant. - Added HTML comment. - Fixed a few errors with rendering as a group.
